website_summaries.verdict: The best value for your money. Extremely sharp blades with lightweight, flexible design and a low price.
pros: Can be used in multiple different configurations
cons: Smaller size makes it not suitable for larger jobs

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Adaptable, Quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't so many reviews, usually becuase I can't be bothered, but this Hacksaw is F-ing awesome. I had a very difficult project, that needed to be done while inside of a cupboard size space on Wood, PVC, and Copper. This saw is extremely adaptable, and because of that I was able to complete the project even with a few unforseen obstacles that any other saw configuration couldn't pull off (Such as sawing a Copper Pipe sideways though a 2" x 8" opening while avoiding the surrounding conduits, all right next to my face.) Good quality, super robust, and surprisingly solid for having a 4-part tension frame.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Sub standard saw
customer_reviews.text: The saw is not for professionals who use a hacksaw more than once a week. The stud that holds the blade in place sheared off. Prior to that the saw fell apart in my hands several times. I thought I wasn't tensioning the blade enough but no matter how tight it would fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Prepared to be angry

customer_reviews.title: Great saw! Blade is dull though
customer_reviews.text: This should be a 5 star review but the blade just isn’t that sharp or good at cutting. The overall setup is nice, and you could always get a better blade to slip on. But I bought this so I didn’t need to waste my time looking for other blades. I wanted it included, which it was...just not as sharp as I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hacksaw, and absolutely love it. I like the fact that it is reconfigurable, yet despite this very sturdy. I was concerned that I would over tighten the blade in this saw due to its modular design, but this isn't the case. I can take the tension up until the blade is really taut without issue or concern for damaging the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine

customer_reviews.title: Bad blade hook design
customer_reviews.text: Would be a good saw if the blade stud/hook was made of something beside soft pot metal. Have used only a few times and this part failed. Drilled a hole and put in a hardened steel rollpin.
